cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to turn northeast and track across Mississippi, Alabama, and central Georgia before exiting into the Atlantic near the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Louisiana coast (Morgan City–New Orleans area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Georgia coast; TS watch/warning limited to Louisiana through western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Intracoastal City, LA, eastward to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (Louisiana–Florida Panhandle) first, then inland across Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia, and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions Sunday with gusts generally 25–35 mph (below tropical-storm force) possible as the system’s remnants pass inland west of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the southeast Georgia coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Sunday–Monday with 3–5 inches and localized higher totals that could produce urban or low-lying flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible across south-central and eastern Georgia on Sunday
